noun.description: An alkaloid isolated from the root of the pomegranate tree, Punica granatum, found to be identical to pelletierine.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Alfred Garrod (1819–1907), physician. From scientific Latin Punica, genus name of the pomegranate (Linnaeus Systema Naturae; ultimately from classical Latin Pūnicum pomegranate, after post-classical Latin malus punica pomegranate) + -in. In sense 1 after French punicine<br>late 19th century. From classical Latin Pūnicus Punic + -in.
